command.tip-1: You can use the Command item type to launch applications or scripts.
command.tip-2: If the path to an executable contains spaces, you should "wrap it in quotes".
command.tip-3: Use {{app_name}} to insert the name of the application which was focused when you opened the menu.
command.tip-4: Use {{window_name}} to insert the name of the window which was focused when you opened the menu.
command.tip-5: Use {{pointer_x}} and {{pointer_y}} to insert the pointer position where the menu was opened.
command.name: Run Command

common.delayed-option-hint: Useful if the action targets a window that needs to be focused.

hotkey.tip-1: When recording a hotkey, you do not have to press all keys at once. You can press them one after another.
hotkey.tip-2: If you cannot record a key because it is used by the system, try typing its name directly.
hotkey.tip-3: Click this link to see all valid key names.
hotkey.name: Simulate Hotkey

macro.tip-1: Per default, Kando adds a 10ms delay before each key event. You can change this with the "delay" property.
macro.tip-2: Click this link to see all valid key names.
macro.name: Simulate Macro

submenu.tip-1: Submenus can be used to group items.
submenu.tip-2: You can also nest submenus inside of submenus.
submenu.tip-3: Submenus can be used to create complex menu structures.
submenu.tip-4: You should avoid adding more than twelve items to a submenu. Eight is a good number.
submenu.tip-5: You can use the tiny lock icons in the preview to fix an item's position in the menu.
submenu.tip-6: You can reorder items by dragging them in the preview.
submenu.tip-7: You can delete a menu by dragging it from the menus tab to the trash tab in the toolbar.
submenu.tip-8: You can remove items by dragging them to the trash tab in the toolbar.
submenu.tip-9: When recording a shortcut, you do not have to press all keys at once. You can press them one after another.
submenu.tip-10: You can copy menus and items by dragging them while holding the Ctrl key.
submenu.tip-11: You can open menus from the command line via the --menu flag.
submenu.name: Submenu

text.tip-1: This action uses your clipboard to paste the text. After using the action, the clipboard will contain the text.
text.name: Paste Text

uri.tip-1: You can use the URI item type to open a website using the http:// protocol.
uri.tip-2: You can use the URI item type to open a file or folder using the file:// protocol.
uri.tip-3: You can use the URI item type to open a mailto: link.
uri.tip-4: Use {{app_name}} to insert the name of the application which was focused when you opened the menu.
uri.tip-5: Use {{window_name}} to insert the name of the window which was focused when you opened the menu.
uri.tip-6: Use {{pointer_x}} and {{pointer_y}} to insert the pointer position where the menu was opened.
uri.name: Open URI

common.menu-conditions-hint: Choose when the menu should be shown.
common.menu-behavior-hint: Tweak advanced options for the menu.

advanced-options.heading: Tweak the Menu's Behavior
advanced-options.subheading: Before you enable these options, we recommend learning Kando's default behavior. Read about why we like it here.
advanced-options.centered-mode-hint: Open the menu in the screen's center instead of at the cursor.
advanced-options.warp-mouse-hint: Move the pointer to the center of the menu when it opens.
advanced-options.anchored-mode-hint: Open submenus at the same position as the parent menu.
advanced-options.anchored-mode-checked-hint: Checking this, will disable Marking Mode.

condition-picker.heading: Select Menu Conditions
condition-picker.subheading: You can bind multiple menus to the same shortcut and then choose under which conditions each menu should be shown.
condition-picker.app-hint: Show the menu only if a specific application is focused.
condition-picker.app-tooltip: Use the app which was focused when the Kando was opened.
condition-picker.window-hint: Show the menu only if the focused window's title contains a given text.
condition-picker.window-tooltip: Use the window which was focused when the Kando was opened.
condition-picker.screen-hint: Show the menu only if the pointer is in a given area on the screen.
condition-picker.screen-checked-hint: In pixels, relative to the top left corner of your main display.
condition-picker.pointer-position-hint: Your mouse is currently at {{x}} x {{y}}.

icon-picker.heading: Select an Icon
icon-picker.subheading: Add your own icon collections by putting a folder with images into {{path}}. You will need to restart Kando. Learn more here.

macro-picker.placeholder: Hit the record button to start recording!

gnome.error: Could not connect to Kando Integration GNOME Shell extension. You can get it from here: {{- link}}

hyprland.shortcut-hint: Use your hyprland.conf to bind this.

kde-wayland.shortcut-hint: Use KDE's system settings to bind this.

sidebar.intro-text: Kando comes with a basic example menu. You can play with it, but you should create your own menus soon! You can open the menu editor by clicking on the gear icon in the lower right corner of the screen.
sidebar.new-version-button: A new version of Kando is available!
sidebar.introduction-tab-slide-1-caption: Click Anywhere: You do not have to exactly click on an item, you just have to click somewhere into its wedge!
sidebar.introduction-tab-slide-2-caption: Go Back: Quickly navigate one level up by clicking the center item.
sidebar.introduction-tab-slide-3-caption: Marking Mode: Drag over an item to enter marking mode. If you pause the pointer movement or make a turn, the currently dragged submenu will be opened.
sidebar.introduction-tab-slide-4-caption: Turbo Mode: If you keep a key pressed after opening the menu, you can perform selections by just moving the pointer. This is the fastest way to select items!
sidebar.introduction-tab-slide-5-caption: No accidental selections: Actions are only executed as soon as you release your mouse button in "Marking Mode" or a keyboard key in "Turbo Mode". Use this to explore the menu!
sidebar.dev-tools-button-tooltip: Open the web developer tools for inspecting the UI.
sidebar.reload-menu-theme-button-tooltip: CSS changes will be applied immediately, for changes made to the theme.json file, you need to re-open the menu.

menu-themes-tab.author: by {{author}}
menu-themes-tab.system-mode-subheading: If enabled, you can choose a different theme and color set if your system is in light or dark color mode.
menu-themes-tab.system-mode-subheading-dark: Your system is currently in dark mode. The settings above will only be used in dark mode.
menu-themes-tab.system-mode-subheading-light: Your system is currently in light mode. The settings above will only be used in light mode.
menu-themes-tab.hint: You can download themes from the theme repository. You can also learn how to create your own themes and share them in Kando's Discord Server!
menu-themes-tab.dark-mode: Use Separate Themes and Colors for Light and Dark Mode
menu-themes-tab.reset-color-picker: Reset all colors to their defaults
menu-themes-tab.label: Menu Themes

templates-tab.heading: Drop menus and menu items here and use them as templates!
templates-tab.subheading: Create copies of the stored items by moving them to the menus tab or to the preview above.
templates-tab.label: Templates

trash-tab.label: Trash
trash-tab.heading: You can delete menus and menu items by dropping them here!
trash-tab.subheading: When you restart Kando, they will be gone.

editor-themes-tab.label: Editor Themes
editor-themes-tab.heading: Here will be a list of available editor themes!
editor-themes-tab.subheading: In the future, it will be possible to theme the entire menu editor.
